caption: The pasta is what they recommended to us, and boy was it delicious. Would recommend the large portion for a regular sized meal. It was so flavorful, and the pasta was perfect consistency! The tiramisu has nuts FYI!

Edi: We didn't have the best experience due to our particular waiter, but I really appreciated the owner response and the remaining staff was so nice and accommodating. We will give it another try in the future!
Made my birthday very special. Food and service is excellent! They go above and beyond to make sure you have a good experience. The views are also great.

Normally I just talk about the food and these days with all the restrictions because of COVID-19, I have been giving a pass on service at restaurants, but these place blew me away with the high level of quality dinning service we received.  I don't remember the last time I received such service and could talk about it in this way.  From the start, when I called to make the reservation, the young lady was engaging and beyond friendly while placing my reservation. She took the time to describe the reservations for the evening and seating options. When we got there, we were greeted warmly and with full attention without distraction. Our server as well as others who partnered with him to complete our dinning experience were properly trained and professional, yet very personable and friendly at during the entire dining experience.  Moving on to the food, the menu isn't large, but there is a good assortment. We decided to go with all appetizers to make our dinner. This was a good move to allow us to try multiple flavors and mix it up with our drinks. Also, with the sunset view, we ate at our leisure.  The Calabrian Garlic Shrimp had an amazing flavor that rocked it. The Burrata is a must as well along with their Seasonal Dips and Roasted Beet Salad.  All bursting with flavor, beautifully plated, and top quality ingredients. For dessert, the Sweet Cream Gelato with Olive Oil and Maldon Salt was a surprisingly good finisher to the meal, but if that is not your thing, their Tiramisu was very good as well.  Pointers would be to make sure you make reservations, dine early for sunset view, and ask for a high table. The high top chairs are surprisingly comfortable. Order your food to share.  We plan to go back and do highly recommend this dinning experience.

Absolutely amazing experience at Quiora. This restaurant is located in the beautiful Ritz Carlton hotel. There was a simple valet service at the front which made our entrance and exit painless. The outdoor dining ambiance is beautiful with lovely views of the pool and city. Every worker that we came in contact with from the hostess, to the servers, to the manager were all incredibly kind and made our dinner so memorable!  The only reason I'm giving this review a 4/5 instead of a 5/5 is because I came from LA which has absolutely amazing Italian food and although this food was delicious it wasn't the 5 star Italian food that I've had (but it was to be expected since this isn't the main food of island).  ~What we ordered~ Drinks: - Ancient Peaks Cab Sauv Bottle. This was an amazing bottle of wine that was reasonably priced. Paired well with everything in our meal.  Appetizers: - Calabrian Garlic Shrimp (Kauai Prawns). Very delicious! I loved the sauce that the prawns were sitting in. Definitely use the bread to dip in the sauce - Buratta. Creamy and delicious. Cannot go wrong  Side: - Charred Broccolini. Broccolini is my absolute favorite vegetable so this side did not disappoint.  Mains: - Porcini Pappardelle. The noodles were thick and delicious. I loved the lightness of the sauce and vegetables to balance the thick noodles. - Spaghetti All’amatriciana. The favorite of the 3 pastas we tried, but be careful because there is a mild spiciness to it if you are sensitive. - Spaghetti Carbonara - pancetta, parmesan, egg, pecorino. The server mixed the egg in throughout the pasta which gave it an overall creamy sauce texture.  Dessert: - Tiramisu. This is the only thing we tried that I wouldn't recommend. This dish needs a lot of work. Didn't taste like a proper tiramisu.
Christmas Day Dinner - It was a set five course menu. Not really my style of food, but overall it was pretty good. I think the normal menu would be better.
Great service and tasty food. Loved the burrata dish. Porchini pepardella was yummy. Also good wine selection. Nice outdoor sitting. Make sure to make a reservation.
Good food always

I recently had the privilege of dining at Quiora for their pasta tasting dinner.  I have been to this fairly new establishment several times and must say that the consistent top notch food/service have made me a lifetime regular guest.  Our pasta dishes were absolutely delicious with so much attention to detail and flavor.  Perfectly paired with wines that also complimented the themed region of Sardinia.  Service was seamless!  Not only were we attended to by our server, but the entire staff seemed to be constantly paying attention to all the fine intricacies of service.  Upon our departure we were given a personalized thank you card with an invite to the next tasting dinner, what a cute touch   Obiviously we will be accepting the invite.  Thank you Kayla, Mindy, Dusty and all of the Quiora staff for a perfect evening!

We chose to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary at the Ritz-Carlton's rustic Italian restaurant, Quiora, which opened just this past November.  However, because of our Statewide stay-at-home orders,  our State's dine-in options have been severely restricted and October 15 turned out to be perfect timing as our State has been re-opening businesses just as it has allowed Trans-Pacific traveler in. Because we were concerned about aerosolized COVID-19 droplets in enclosed dining spaces, we sought out Quiora's casual alfresco dining layout overlooking Fort DeRussy Beach Park out to the ocean.  We made our dinner reservations via OpenTable.com and chose a time that would allow us to catch the colorful sky from the setting sun during the early part of our celebration.  Arriving at the porte cochère, we were directed to the valets who greeted us with Aloha as we dropped off our vehicle into their care.  A hostess met us as we exited our vehicle, checked us in against her reservations list, and summoned an elevator for us to take up non-stop to the 8th floor.   We exited the elevator lobby and was met by Tina, who had called earlier in the day to confirm our contact information for contact tracing, as she congratulated and thanked us for choosing Quiora and the Ritz-Carlton.  We were escorted to their Diamond Head Tower where Quiora's hostess took over and got us seated at a high top (of our choice).   Being that this was our first time to dine at Quiora, we surely appreciated the personally escorted tour from the elevator to the restaurant.  Our server, Kayla, immediately congratulated us on our Wedding Anniversary and greeted us with professional yet warm hospitality.  We could see her smiles in her eyes and friendly voice as she articulated Quiora's menu of rustic and seasonal Italian cuisine featuring locally-sourced fresh vegetables and seafood.  Quiora is noted for their fresh house-made kinds of pasta which their executive Chef specializes in.  We toasted our special occasion and placed meal orders with Kayla. Kayla's service partner was Mindy, who interchangeably brought out our dishes at an easy pace and chatted with us while either she or Kayla cleared our table.  From start to finish, our experience and dine was fantastic.  Everyone was respectful and truly appreciative of our patronage.  They all kept their face masks on throughout the experience.  Wewrecomfortambiance. sanitizing wipes as we got into our car.

Been dinning at both Quiora and La vie for a few months now. I’m not particularly impressed by the food but the overall service is good. I really love the staff! Always extremely friendly, pleasant and helpful, something quite rare in Europe. To me this is not really Italian food but what would you expect on an Island so far from any continent? All restaurants’ cuisine on Hawaii is adapted to the products they can get and have both American and Asian influences. Nevertheless, I would recommend this dining experience. The food is quite good, the price is quite reasonable for Waikiki. The views is amazing and the staff is absolutely delightful. Wine lovers ask for Dusty!

Husband took me here as a surprise for date nite. It was amazing. The atmosphere was breathtaking with the sunset. Customer service was 100% on point. Very friendly,  welcoming and genuine.  The food , oh man the steak melted in my mouth,  perfect !!!!  We will definitely be back so I can try the spaghetti.   Our server was awesome, made us feel comfortable.  Everyone needs to try this place , you won't be disappointed.

Dinned here for the 1st night of the reopening of restaurants in Waikiki and what a special night it was. My wife and I celebrated our "belated" anniversary as it was back and February and for one was out of country and two right when COVID started to close things down. The service and enthusiasm of the staff all the way from when we pulled into the valet was top notch. I gave my name to the valet and magically the whole place knew who we were for our reservation and treated us so well like friends and family.  Everyone was so excited to have us dine with them on the first night of reopening and it really showed in their service. The view if such a great one, open air seating and perfect for a 6:30 reservation to watch the sun go down. The drinks were great to start off with and the food was really great. No over the top but simple straight to the point flavoring and fresh. Definitely a great time and will for sure come back here and to try the other restaurants in the Ritz.
Fabulous meal. We didn’t expect much from a “hotel” restaurant but we were delighted by the meal and the service. Highly recommended.
Gorgeous sunset views. Delicious food and great service!

Amazing! This was my second time eating at Quiora and I can't wait for my third! The food here is so delicious,  and the staff is wonderful. Great views of the sunset so bring your sunglasses. Definitely a must visit!

(Translated by Google) A casual Italian shop in Ritz-Carlton Waikiki. Tonight was Christmas and there was a $ 125 course. The à la carte was less than usual, but it was said that it could be prepared. This was a big mistake. I chose it myself. . .  3 appetizers. The hamachi carpaccio is full of fishy odors ... I didn't like the octopus squid ink, but the other hamachi kama laughed if it was Japanese. The taste is ok, but tiny. The feeling of purchasing cheaply in the market is overflowing.  Next is pasta. Persimmon pasta is probably home-made hand-made noodles and is well cooked. It is the best taste I have eaten today, with a refined taste that takes advantage of the flavor of the salmon. Three fish ravioli are about 1/3 the size of Japanese dumplings. Small ... The taste was quite good.  Mainly shrimp and white fish. This is not bad either. But tiny ... And the cauliflower on the side is scorching ...  Dessert is a choice of tiramisu and panna cotta. It is delicious. Dessert is big for some reason.  I like the thin seasoning while valuing the taste of the material as a whole, but all are made up of cheap materials such as shrimp, octopus, hamachi, etc. There is no. Even if we reduce the number of items, it is a pity that we should make the material attractive. Compared to Bernini near Ala Moana last year, satisfaction was less than half.  What made me feel even worse was the atmosphere inside the restaurant, like the breakfast hall of a third-class hotel. All you have to do is put a table and chairs in a space where there was no other use, and make a restaurant appearance. Also, I wanted to put a little decoration, I put a wall with ALOHA letters on a wooden board with a surfboard, but the front was not good, but the back was bare without makeup and I could see the fastener Yes. Speaking of “casual” sounds good, but the atmosphere in this store will be disappointing even if you enter for lunch. However, customer service is a good impression. A smile came out and I can tell you that he always cares. Since the pasta was delicious, there is a sense of expectation that the usual menu seems to be satisfactory. But if you think that burnt cauliflower came out, I feel a little dangerous. It is a pity that the dishes are cheap.  I'd like to go on a non-special day next time, but be careful on days when you want to cook course meals. Choose Taormina if you don't want to remove it in Waikiki Italian. If it's cheap, Appetito is also good.  (Original) リッツカールトンワイキキ内にあるカジュアルイタリアンの店。 今宵はクリスマスということでコース$125がありました。アラカルトも普段より少ない品数だが用意できるとの事でしたが、せっかくなのでコースをチョイス。 これが大きな間違いでした。自分で選んだんですけどね。。。  前菜3品。ハマチのカルパッチョは魚臭さが全開でイマイチ... タコのイカ墨の一品は良かったものの、もう一品のハマチのカマは日本人なら笑って(いや、怒って？)しまうレベル。味はまあまあ、しかしちっちゃい。市場で安く仕入れた感が溢れています。  続いてパスタ。蟹のパスタはおそらくホームメイドの手打ち麺で茹で具合も良し。蟹の風味を活かした上品な味わいで、今日食べた中で一番良かったです。魚のラビオリは日本の餃子の1/3ほどの大きさのものが3つ。小さい... 味はなかなかでしたけどね。  メインはエビと白身魚。これも悪くない。しかしちっちゃい... あと、サイドのカリフラワーは焦げまくり...  デザートはティラミスとパンナコッタのチョイス。 普通に美味しい。デザートはなぜか大きめ。  全体的に素材の味を大切にしながら薄めの味付けで私は好きですが、どれもボリュームが少ないのと、エビとかタコ、ハマチなど安めの素材で構成されていて、クリスマスとはいえ$125の価値は無い。 品数を減らしてでも、素材を魅力のあるものにしたらいいのに残念です。 昨年行ったアラモアナ近くのベルニーニに比べると、満足度は半分以下でした。  さらに気分が下がったのは、3流ホテルの朝食会場のような店内の雰囲気。他に用途がなかったスペースに無理矢理テーブルと椅子を置いてレストランの体裁を作っているだけです。 あと、少しでも装飾を入れたかったのでしょう、サーフボードをあしらった木製ボードにALOHAの文字を入れたウォールを置いていましたが、正面もイマイチながら、裏は化粧なしの剥き出しで留め具が見えている。 「カジュアル」と言えば聞こえはいいが、この店内の雰囲気はランチで入店したとしてもガッカリすることでしょう。 ただ、接客は好印象。笑顔が出ていたし、いつも気にかけてくれているのが伝わります。 パスタは美味しかったので、普段のメニューは満足出来そうな期待感はあります。でも焦げたカリフラワーが出てきたことを思えば、ちょっと危険な気もします。 食器類も安っぽいのが残念。  次回は特別な日以外で行ってみたいと思いますが、コース料理を出すような日は要注意。 ワイキキのイタリアンで外したくなければ、ぜひタオルミーナを選択してください。安めならAppetito もいいですよ。

I'm sorry but I did not find this even close to authentic Italian food. I have lived in Europe the majority of my life and had the privilege of going to Italy multiple times and have experienced real Italian food I also have experience American Italian food this fell short. I got the carbonara which was served in a dog bowl of sorts it was a very mediocre presentation of a meal and that's all that was served a bowl with pasta which appeared to be some type of cheesy sauce with an egg on top with pancetta mixed in.  Not really what you would expect of a traditional carbonara you would think when you charge $20+  for a bowl of pasta and a sauce you would have serve bread alongside it. The menu was extremely limited

What an amazing place! Food was great and the service wonderful. They have a semi-outdoor seating area with sunset views. We particularly enjoyed that we had not the feeling of being “rushed out” of the restaurant. On the contrary: after dinner we were able to remain at our table for 2 more hours having drinks with friends! Thank you for a great night! We will certainly be back!
Delicious food and great staff!
